title: Relates to the transitioning age of students with disabilities
summary: Provides that the transitioning age of students with disabilities shall commence at the age of fourteen years.

       Introduced by M. of A. JAFFEE -- read once and referred to the Committee

       AN  ACT to amend the education law, in relation to the transitioning age
         of students with disabilities

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Subdivision  9  of  section 4401 of the education law, as
    2  amended by chapter 378 of the laws  of  2007,  is  amended  to  read  as
    3  follows:
    4    9.  "Transition  services"  shall mean a coordinated set of activities
    5  for a student with a disability, designed to be within a results-orient-
    6  ed process, that is focused on improving  the  academic  and  functional
    7  achievement of the student with a disability to facilitate movement from
    8  school  to  post-school  activities, including post-secondary education,
    9  vocational education, integrated employment (including supported employ-
   10  ment), continuing  and  adult  education,  adult  services,  independent
   11  living,  or  community  participation. The coordinated set of activities
   12  shall be based upon the student's strengths, preferences and  interests,
   13  and  shall include instruction, related services, community experiences,
   14  the development of employment and other post-school adult living  objec-
   15  tives,  and,  if  appropriate,  acquisition  of  daily living skills and
   16  provision of  a  functional  vocational  evaluation.    SUCH  TRANSITION
   17  SERVICES  SHALL  BEGIN  WHEN  SUCH STUDENT WITH A DISABILITY IS FOURTEEN
   18  YEARS OF AGE.
   19    S 2. Subdivision 9 of section 4401 of the education law, as amended by
   20  chapter 311 of the laws of 1999, is amended to read as follows:
   21    9. "Transition services" shall mean a coordinated  set  of  activities
   22  for  a  student  with  a disability, designed within an outcome-oriented
   23  process, which promotes movement from school to post-school  activities,
   24  including  post-secondary  education,  vocational  training,  integrated
   25  competitive employment (including supported employment), continuing  and
